longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to protect the privacy of individuals in relation to personal data, and to provide for matters incidental thereto or connected therewith.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance.
This Ordinance shall come into operation on a day to be appointed by the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs by notice in the Gazette. (Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: act (作為) includes a deliberate omission;
appointed day (指定日) means the day appointed under section 1(2);
change notice (變更通知) means a notice served on the Commissioner under section 14(8) and, if applicable, corrected under section 14A(5); (Added 18 of 2012 s. 3)

def.name: CodeOfPractice
def.leadIn: code of practice (實務守則) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a standard;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a specification; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other documentary form of practical guidance;

subsection.def: Commissioner (專員) means the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data established under section 5(1);
complainant (投訴人) means the individual, or the relevant person on behalf of an individual, who has made a complaint;
complaint (投訴) means a complaint under section 37;
correction (改正), in relation to personal data, means rectification, erasure or completion;
daily penalty (每日罰款) means a penalty for each day on which the offence is continued after conviction therefor;
data access request (查閱資料要求) means a request under section 18;
data correction request (改正資料要求) means a request under section 22(1);
data protection principle (保障資料原則) means any of the data protection principles set out in Schedule 1;
data subject (資料當事人), in relation to personal data, means the individual who is the subject of the data;
data user (資料使用者), in relation to personal data, means a person who, either alone or jointly or in common with other persons, controls the collection, holding, processing or use of the data;
data user return (資料使用者申報表) means a return submitted to the Commissioner under section 14(4) and, if applicable, corrected under section 14A(5); (Replaced 18 of 2012 s. 3)

def.name: Document
def.leadIn: document (文件) includes, in addition to a document in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a disc, tape or other device in which data other than visual images is embodied so as to be capable, with or without the aid of some other equipment, of being reproduced from the disc, tape or other device; and (Amended 17 of 2018 s. 126)

paragraph.name: b

def.name: Employment
def.leadIn: employment (僱用) means employment under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a contract of service or of apprenticeship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contract personally to execute any work or labour,

def.continued: and related expressions shall be construed accordingly;

subsection.def: enforcement notice (執行通知) means a notice under section 50(1);
family member (家人), in relation to a person, means another person who is related to the person by blood, marriage, adoption or affinity; (Added 32 of 2021 s. 3)

def.name: FinancialRegulator
def.leadIn: financial regulator (財經規管者) means any of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority appointed under section 5A of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Securities and Futures Commission referred to in section 3(1) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); (Replaced 5 of 2002 s. 407)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a recognized clearing house, a recognized exchange company, a recognized exchange controller or a recognized investor compensation company within the meaning of section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); (Replaced 5 of 2002 s. 407)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person authorized under Part III of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) to provide automated trading services as defined in Schedule 5 to that Ordinance; (Replaced 5 of 2002 s. 407)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Insurance Authority established under section 4AAA of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 133)

paragraph.name: g
ga
paragraph.content: the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority established by section 6 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485); (Added 4 of 1998 s. 14)

paragraph.name: gb
paragraph.content: the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council continued under section 6 of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); (Added 18 of 2006 s. 84. Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a person specified in a notice under subsection (7) to be a regulator for the purposes of this definition;

subsection.def: inspection (視察) means an inspection under section 36;
investigation (調查) means (except in Part 9A) an investigation under section 38; (Amended 32 of 2021 s. 3)

def.name: MatchingProcedure
def.leadIn: matching procedure (核對程序) means any procedure whereby personal data collected for 1 or more purposes in respect of 10 or more data subjects is compared (except by manual means) with personal data collected for any other purpose in respect of those data subjects where the comparison— (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is (whether in whole or in part) for the purpose of producing or verifying data that; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: produces or verifies data in respect of which it is reasonable to believe that it is practicable that the data,

def.continued: may be used (whether immediately or at any subsequent time) for the purpose of taking adverse action against any of those data subjects;

subsection.def: matching procedure request (核對程序要求) means a request under section 31(1);

def.name: PersonalData
def.leadIn: personal data (個人資料) means any data—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: relating directly or indirectly to a living individual;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: from which it is practicable for the identity of the individual to be directly or indirectly ascertained; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in a form in which access to or processing of the data is practicable;

subsection.def: personal data system (個人資料系統) means any system, whether or not automated, which is used, whether in whole or in part, by a data user for the collection, holding, processing or use of personal data, and includes any document and equipment forming part of the system;

def.name: PersonalIdentifier
def.leadIn: personal identifier (個人身分標識符) means an identifier—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is assigned to an individual by a data user for the purpose of the operations of the user; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that uniquely identifies that individual in relation to the data user,

def.continued: but does not include an individual’s name used to identify that individual;

subsection.def: practicable (切實可行) means reasonably practicable;
prescribed information (訂明資訊) means any information specified in Schedule 3; (Added 18 of 2012 s. 3)
prescribed officer (訂明人員) means a person employed or engaged under section 9(1);

def.name: RelevantDataUser
def.leadIn: relevant data user (有關資料使用者), in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an inspection, means the data user who uses the personal data system which is the subject of the inspection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a complaint, means the data user specified in the complaint;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: an investigation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of an investigation initiated by a complaint, means the data user specified in the complaint;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other case, means the data user the subject of the investigation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an enforcement notice, means the data user on whom the notice is served;

def.name: RelevantPerson
def.leadIn: relevant person (有關人士), in relation to an individual (howsoever the individual is described), means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the individual is a minor, a person who has parental responsibility for the minor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the individual is incapable of managing his own affairs, a person who has been appointed by a court to manage those affairs;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the individual is mentally incapacitated within the meaning of section 2 of the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person appointed under section 44A, 59O or 59Q of that Ordinance to be the guardian of that individual; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the guardianship of that individual is vested in, or the functions of the appointed guardian are to be performed by, the Director of Social Welfare or any other person under section 44B(2A) or (2B) or 59T(1) or (2) of that Ordinance, the Director of Social Welfare or that other person; (Replaced 18 of 2012 s. 3)

def.name: Requestor
def.leadIn: requestor (提出要求者), in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a matching procedure request, means the data user who has made the request;

def.name: RuleOfLaw
def.leadIn: rule of law (法律規則) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a rule of common law or a rule of equity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: customary law; (Added 18 of 2012 s. 3)

subsection.def: specified (指明), in relation to a form, means specified under section 67;

def.name: ThirdParty
def.leadIn: third party (第三者), in relation to personal data, means any person other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the data subject;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a relevant person in the case of the data subject;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the data user; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a person authorized in writing by the data user to collect, hold, process or use the data—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: under the direct control of the data user; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on behalf of the data user;

subsection.def: use (使用), in relation to personal data, includes disclose or transfer the data;
would be likely to prejudice (相當可能損害) includes would prejudice.

subsection.leadIn: Where under this Ordinance an act may be done with the prescribed consent of a person (and howsoever the person is described), such consent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means the express consent of the person given voluntarily;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include any consent which has been withdrawn by notice in writing served on the person to whom the consent has been given (but without prejudice to so much of that act that has been done pursuant to the consent at any time before the notice is so served).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 64A, any reference in this Ordinance to the effect that a data user (howsoever described)— (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 3; 17 of 2018 s. 126)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has contravened a requirement under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is contravening a requirement under this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: includes—

paragraph.name: i
ii
paragraph.content: where paragraph (b) is applicable, any case where the data user is doing an act, or engaging in a practice, in contravention of a data protection principle.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Ordinance, a complaint may be made (and an investigation, if any, initiated by the complaint may be carried out) in relation to a person who has ceased to be a data user except any such person who has not at any time been a data user during the period of 2 years immediately preceding the date on which the Commissioner receives the complaint and, accordingly, a person in relation to whom such a complaint is made shall for the purposes of such complaint (and an investigation, if any, initiated by such complaint) be deemed to be a data user, and the other provisions of this Ordinance shall be construed accordingly.
Any reference in this Ordinance to a data protection principle followed by a number is a reference to the principle bearing that number set out in Schedule 1.
The Chief Executive may, by notice in the Gazette, specify a person to be a regulator for the purposes of the definition of financial regulator. (Amended 34 of 1999 s. 3)
It is hereby declared that a notice under subsection (7) is subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds any office, engages in any profession or carries on any occupation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is required by any law, or by any rules made under or by virtue of any law, to be a fit and proper person (or words to the like effect) to hold that office, engage in that profession or carry on that occupation,

subsection.continued: then, for the purposes of this Ordinance, any conduct by that person by virtue of which he ceases, or would cease, to be such a fit and proper person shall be deemed to be seriously improper conduct.

subsection.content: Subsection (9) shall not operate to prevent seriously improper conduct including, for the purposes of this Ordinance, conduct by virtue of which a person ceases, or would cease, to be a fit and proper person notwithstanding that the conduct is not conduct to which that subsection applies.
Words and expressions importing the neuter gender in relation to any data user shall include the masculine and feminine genders.

A person is not a data user in relation to any personal data which the person holds, processes or uses solely on behalf of another person if, but only if, that first-mentioned person does not hold, process or use, as the case may be, the data for any of his own purposes. (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 2)

For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that, for the purposes of this Ordinance, any conduct by a person by virtue of which he has or could become a disqualified person or a suspended person under the Rules of Racing and Instructions by the Stewards of the Hong Kong Jockey Club, as in force from time to time, is seriously improper conduct. (Amended 34 of 1999 s. 3)
This Ordinance binds the Government.

editorialNote.content: * See Decision of the Standing Committee of the National People’s Congress Concerning the Handling of the Laws Previously in Force in Hong Kong in accordance with Article 160 of the Basic Law of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China which is published in Hong Kong e-Legislation as Instrument A206.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Data protection principles
section.content: A data user shall not do an act, or engage in a practice, that contravenes a data protection principle unless the act or practice, as the case may be, is required or permitted under this Ordinance.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Establishment, etc. of Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, there is hereby established an office by the name of the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall be a corporation sole with perpetual succession and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall have and may use a seal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be capable of suing and being sued.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive shall, by notice in the Gazette, appoint a person to be the Commissioner. (Amended 34 of 1999 s. 3)
Subject to subsection (5), the person appointed to be the Commissioner shall hold office for a period of 5 years and shall be eligible for reappointment for not more than 1 further period of 5 years.

subsection.leadIn: The person appointed to be the Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at any time resign from his office by notice in writing to the Chief Executive; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be removed from office by the Chief Executive with the approval by resolution of the Legislative Council on the ground of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: inability to perform the functions of his office; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: misbehaviour. (Amended 34 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive shall determine— (Amended 34 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the emoluments; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the terms and conditions of appointment,

subsection.continued: of the person appointed to be the Commissioner.

subsection.content: The provisions of Schedule 2 shall have effect with respect to the Commissioner.
Subject to subsection (9), the Commissioner shall not be regarded as a servant or agent of the Government or as enjoying any status, immunity or privilege of the Government.

subsection.leadIn: The person appointed to be the Commissioner shall be deemed to be a public servant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within the meaning of section 2 of the Prevention of Bribery Ordinance (Cap. 201); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of that Ordinance.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Commissioner to hold no other office
section.leadIn: The person appointed to be the Commissioner shall not, without the specific approval of the Chief Executive— (Amended 34 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hold any office of profit other than his office as Commissioner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: engage in any occupation for reward outside the functions of his office.

subsection.leadIn: Where the person appointed to be the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: dies;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: resigns;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is removed from office;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is absent from Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is for any other reason unable to perform the functions of his office,

subsection.continued: then the Chief Executive may, by notice in writing, appoint a person to act as the Commissioner until, as the case requires— (Amended 34 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a new Commissioner is appointed under section 5(3); or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the Commissioner resumes his office.

subsection.leadIn: A person appointed under subsection (1) to act as the Commissioner, whilst he is so appointed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall perform the functions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may exercise the powers,

subsection.continued: of the Commissioner under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Section 6 shall apply to a person appointed under subsection (1) to act as the Commissioner as if that person were the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: monitor and supervise compliance with the provisions of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: promote and assist bodies representing data users to prepare, for the purposes of section 12, codes of practice for guidance in complying with the provisions of this Ordinance, in particular the data protection principles;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: promote awareness and understanding of, and compliance with, the provisions of this Ordinance, in particular the data protection principles;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: examine any proposed legislation (including subsidiary legislation) that the Commissioner considers may affect the privacy of individuals in relation to personal data and report the results of the examination to the person proposing the legislation;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: carry out inspections, including inspections of any personal data systems used by data users which are departments of the Government or statutory corporations;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: for the better performance of his other functions, undertake research into, and monitor developments in, the processing of data and information technology in order to take account of any likely adverse effects such developments may have on the privacy of individuals in relation to personal data; (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 4)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: liaise and co-operate with any person in any place outside Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: performing in that place any functions which, in the opinion of the Commissioner, are similar (whether in whole or in part) to any of the Commissioner’s functions under this Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in respect of matters of mutual interest concerning the privacy of individuals in relation to personal data; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: perform such other functions as are imposed on him under this Ordinance or any other enactment.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may do all such things as are necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the better performance of his functions and in particular but without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: acquire and hold property of any description if in the opinion of the Commissioner such property is necessary for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the accommodation of the Commissioner or of any prescribed officer; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the performance of any function which the Commissioner may perform,

paragraph.continued: and, subject to the terms and conditions upon which such property is held, dispose of it;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter into, carry out, assign or accept the assignment of, vary or rescind, any contract, agreement or other obligation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: undertake and execute any lawful trust which has as an object the furtherance of any function which the Commissioner is required or is permitted by this Ordinance to perform or any other similar object;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: accept gifts and donations, whether subject to any trust or not;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: with the prior approval of the Chief Executive, become a member of or affiliate to any international body concerned with (whether in whole or in part) the privacy of individuals in relation to personal data; (Amended 34 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: carry out promotional or educational activities or services; and (Added 18 of 2012 s. 4)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: exercise such other powers as are conferred on him under this Ordinance or any other enactment.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Commissioner may impose reasonable charges for any promotional or educational activities or services carried out, or any promotional or educational publications or materials made available, by the Commissioner in the course of the performance of the Commissioner’s functions under this Ordinance. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 4)

The Commissioner may make and execute any document in the performance of his functions or the exercise of his powers or in connection with any matter reasonably incidental to or consequential upon the performance of his functions or the exercise of his powers.
Any document purporting to be executed under the seal of the Commissioner shall be admitted in evidence and shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be deemed to have been duly executed.

The Commissioner may from time to time cause to be prepared and published by notice in the Gazette, for the guidance of data users and data subjects, guidelines not inconsistent with this Ordinance, indicating the manner in which he proposes to perform any of his functions, or exercise any of his powers, under this Ordinance. (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: employ such persons (including technical and professional persons); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: engage, other than by way of employment, such technical and professional persons,

subsection.continued: as he thinks fit to assist him in the performance of his functions, and the exercise of his powers, under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the remuneration and terms and conditions of employment of any person, or any person belonging to a class of persons, who may be employed under subsection (1)(a);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the remuneration and terms and conditions of engagement of any person, or any person belonging to a class of persons, who may be engaged under subsection (1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grant, or make provision for the grant of, pensions, gratuities and retirement benefits to employees;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide other benefits for the welfare of employees and their dependants;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: authorize payments, whether or not legally due, to the personal representatives of a deceased employee or to any person who was dependent on such employee at his death.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: establish, manage and control; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter into an arrangement with any company or association for the establishment, management and control by that company or association either alone or jointly with the Commissioner of,

subsection.continued: any fund or scheme for the purpose of providing for the pensions, gratuities, benefits and payments referred to in subsection (3).

subsection.content: The Commissioner may make contributions to and may require employees to make contributions to any fund or scheme referred to in subsection (4).

subsection.def: In this section employees (僱員) includes any class of employee which the Commissioner specifies and in subsection (3) includes former employees.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Commissioner may delegate in writing any of his functions or powers under this Ordinance to any prescribed officer subject to such terms and conditions, if any, as he thinks fit and specified in the delegation.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall not delegate any of his functions or powers under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any provisions of any regulations made under this Ordinance which are specified in the regulations as provisions which shall not be subject to subsection (1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any provisions of Schedule 2 which are specified in that Schedule as provisions which shall not be subject to subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: A delegate of the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall perform the delegated functions and may exercise the delegated powers as if the delegate were the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be presumed to be acting in accordance with the relevant delegation in the absence of evidence to the contrary.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Establishment of Personal Data (Privacy) Advisory Committee

subsection.content: There is hereby established a committee by the name of the Personal Data (Privacy) Advisory Committee for the purpose of advising the Commissioner upon any matter relevant to the privacy of individuals in relation to personal data or otherwise relevant to the operation of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Committee shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner, who shall be the chairman; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: not less than 4 or more than 8 other persons, appointed by the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs, of whom—

subparagraph.content: not less than 1 shall have not less than 5 years’ experience in the processing of data; and
not more than 1 shall be a public officer.

subsection.content: The members of the Committee appointed under subsection (2)(b) shall hold office for such period and upon such terms as the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs specifies in their respective appointments or from time to time.
A member of the Committee appointed under subsection (2)(b) may resign at any time by notice in writing delivered to the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs.
The Committee may regulate its procedure.

No civil liability is incurred by the person appointed to be the Commissioner under section 5(3) or a prescribed officer in respect of anything done or omitted to be done by the person or officer in good faith in the performance or purported performance of any function, or the exercise or purported exercise of any power, imposed or conferred on the Commissioner or officer under this Ordinance.

The protection conferred under subsection (1) on any person in respect of anything done or omitted to be done does not in any way affect the civil liability of the Commissioner as a corporation sole for that thing.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Approval of codes of practice by Commissioner

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (8) and (9), for the purpose of providing practical guidance in respect of any requirements under this Ordinance imposed on data users, the Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: approve and issue such codes of practice (whether prepared by him or not) as in his opinion are suitable for that purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approve such codes of practice issued or proposed to be issued otherwise than by him as in his opinion are suitable for that purpose.

subsection.leadIn: Where a code of practice is approved under subsection (1), the Commissioner shall, by notice in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the code concerned and specify the date on which its approval is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify for which of the requirements under this Ordinance the code is so approved.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from time to time revise the whole or any part of any code of practice prepared by him under this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approve any revision or proposed revision of the whole or any part of any code of practice for the time being approved under this section,

subsection.continued: and the provisions of subsection (2) shall, with the necessary modifications, apply in relation to the approval of any revision under this subsection as they apply in relation to the approval of a code of practice under subsection (1).

subsection.content: The Commissioner may at any time withdraw his approval from any code of practice approved under this section.

Where under subsection (4) the Commissioner withdraws his approval from a code of practice approved under this section, he shall, by notice in the Gazette, identify the code concerned and specify the date on which his approval of it is to cease to have effect.

References in this Ordinance to an approved code of practice are references to that code as it has effect for the time being by virtue of any revision of the whole or any part of it approved under this section.

subsection.def: The power of the Commissioner under subsection (1)(b) to approve a code of practice issued or proposed to be issued otherwise than by him shall include power to approve a part of such a code and, accordingly, in this Ordinance code of practice (實務守則) may be read as including a part of such a code.

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall, not later than 6 months after the day on which this section comes into operation (or within such further period, not exceeding 6 months, as the Secretary for Home Affairs may allow), approve a code of practice under subsection (1) in respect of all or any requirements referred to in that subsection in so far as such requirements relate to personal data which is a personal identifier. (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 2; 17 of 2018 s. 127)

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall, before approving a code of practice under subsection (1) or any revision or proposed revision of the code under subsection (3), consult with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such bodies representative of data users to which the code or the code as so revised, as the case may be, will apply (whether in whole or in part); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other interested persons,

subsection.continued: as he thinks fit.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that different codes of practice may be approved under subsection (1) (including any code of practice referred to in subsection (8)) for different classes of data users, and may be so approved for the same or different requirements referred to in subsection (1).

section.name: s13
section.heading: Use of approved codes of practice in proceedings under this Ordinance

subsection.content: A failure on the part of any data user to observe any provision of an approved code of practice shall not of itself render the data user liable to any civil or criminal proceedings but where in any proceedings under this Ordinance a data user is alleged to have contravened a requirement under this Ordinance, being a requirement for which there was an approved code of practice at the time of the alleged contravention, subsection (2) shall have effect with respect to such code in relation to those proceedings.

Any provision of a code of practice which appears to a specified body to be relevant to a requirement under this Ordinance alleged to have been contravened shall be admissible in evidence in the proceedings under this Ordinance concerned and if it is proved that there was at any material time a failure to observe any provision of the code which appears to that body to be relevant to any matter which it is necessary to prove in order to establish a contravention of such requirement, that matter shall be taken as proved in the absence of evidence that such requirement was in respect of that matter complied with otherwise than by way of observance of that provision.

In any proceedings under this Ordinance, a code of practice which appears to a specified body to be the subject of a notice under section 12 shall be taken to be the subject of such notice in the absence of evidence to the contrary.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: proceedings under this Ordinance (根據本條例進行的法律程序) includes any criminal proceedings where a data user is alleged to have committed an offence by reason of a contravention of a requirement under this Ordinance;

def.name: SpecifiedBody
def.leadIn: specified body (指明當局) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a magistrate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a court; (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 6)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Administrative Appeals Board; or (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 6)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the chairman of the Administrative Appeals Board. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 6)

part.name: P4
part.heading: Data User Returns and Register of Data Users

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Commissioner may, by notice in the Gazette, specify a class of data users to which this section shall apply.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall, before specifying a class of data users in a notice under subsection (1), consult with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such bodies representative of data users belonging to that class; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other interested persons,

subsection.continued: as he thinks fit.

subsection.content: This section shall not apply to a data user except a data user belonging to a class of data users specified in a notice under subsection (1) which is in force.

subsection.leadIn: A data user shall submit to the Commissioner a return— (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: containing the prescribed information required by the return in relation to the data user;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of—

subparagraph.content: a data user which belongs to the class of data users concerned on the day on which the notice under subsection (1) specifying that class commences, not earlier than 3 months before, and not later than, each anniversary of that day;

a data user which first belongs to the class of data users concerned on a day after the day on which the notice under subsection (1) specifying that class commences, not earlier than 3 months before, and not later than, each anniversary of that first-mentioned day; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall cause a notice to be published not less than once during every period of 6 months—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in—

subparagraph.content: the Gazette; and

not less than 1 Chinese language newspaper (and in the Chinese language) and not less than 1 English language newspaper (and in the English language), each of which shall be a newspaper circulating generally in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (6), specifying the places at which and the hours during which data user returns are available to data users for the purposes of this section. (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 7)

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall not exercise his power under subsection (5)(b) to specify places which are Government offices unless and until he has the approval in writing of the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs to do so. (Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall cause data user returns to be available to data users— (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: free of charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the places and during the hours specified in the last notice published under subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: Where any prescribed information contained in a data user return submitted under subsection (4) to the Commissioner by a data user changes subsequent to the submission, then the data user shall serve a notice in writing on the Commissioner specifying such change—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if, but only if—

subparagraph.content: such information is specified in the return as information to which this subsection applies; and

subparagraph.leadIn: the return contains, or has annexed to it—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a copy of this subsection; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a statement summarizing the requirement imposed by this subsection on the data user; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not later than 30 days after such change.

subsection.leadIn: It is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice under subsection (1) is subsidiary legislation; and (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 7)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where a data user belongs to 2 or more classes of data users specified in 2 or more notices under subsection (1) which are in force, then, for the purposes of this section, that data user shall be deemed to belong only to that class of data users specified in the first of those notices to be published in the Gazette. (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 7)

subsection.content: A data user who, in purported compliance with subsection (4) or (8), knowingly or recklessly in a data user return or change notice supplies any information which is false or misleading in a material particular, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of verifying the accuracy of information in a data user return or change notice, the Commissioner may, by written notice served on any of the persons specified in subsection (2), reasonably require the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide any document, record, information or thing specified in the written notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to respond in writing to any question specified in the written notice.

subsection.leadIn: The persons are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the data user; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person whom the Commissioner has reasonable grounds to believe may be able to assist in verifying any information in the data user return or change notice.

subsection.content: A person on whom a notice is served under subsection (1) may refuse to provide any document, record, information or thing, or any response to any question, specified in the notice, if the person is entitled or obliged under any other Ordinance to do so.

If, having regard to any document, record, information or thing, or any response to any question, provided under subsection (1), the Commissioner has reasonable grounds to believe that any information in a data user return or change notice is inaccurate, the Commissioner may, by written notice, require the data user to correct the information in the data user return or change notice.
Subject to subsection (3), a person on whom a notice is served under subsection (1) or (4) must comply with the requirement within such reasonable period as is specified in the notice.
A person who contravenes subsection (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

A person who, in purported compliance with a notice under subsection (1), knowingly or recklessly provides any document, record, information or thing, or any response to any question, which is false or misleading in a material particular, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

A data user who, in purported compliance with a notice under subsection (4), knowingly or recklessly in a data user return or change notice supplies any information which is false or misleading in a material particular, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
The Commissioner must keep and maintain a register of data users who have submitted data user returns, using information in those returns and in any change notices. (Replaced 18 of 2012 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: The register shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the form of a database; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain, in respect of each data user who has submitted a data user return, such particulars of the information supplied in that return and any change notice as the Commissioner thinks fit. (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 9)

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, by notice in writing served on a data user, require the data user to submit a notice in the specified form containing such prescribed information in relation to the data user as the Commissioner may reasonably require in order to keep and maintain the register in so far as it relates to that data user, and the data user shall so submit the second-mentioned notice within such period (being a period of not less than 30 days after service of the first-mentioned notice) and in such manner as the Commissioner requires in the first-mentioned notice. (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: Where any prescribed information submitted to the Commissioner under subsection (3) by a data user changes subsequent to the submission, then the data user shall serve a notice in writing on the Commissioner specifying such change—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if, but only if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: such information is specified in the notice concerned under that subsection as information to which this subsection applies; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the notice referred to in subparagraph (i) contains, or has annexed to it—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a copy of this subsection; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a statement summarizing the requirement imposed by this subsection on the data user; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not later than 30 days after such change.

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: A data user who, in purported compliance with subsection (3) or (4), knowingly or recklessly in a notice submitted to or served on the Commissioner supplies any information which is false or misleading in a material particular, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 9)

If the Commissioner is satisfied that a person has ceased to be a data user, he may delete from the register any particulars contained therein relating to that person in that person’s capacity as a data user.

A person who has ceased to be a data user may, by notice in the specified form served on the Commissioner, request the Commissioner to delete from the register the particulars contained therein relating to that person in that person’s capacity as a data user, and the Commissioner shall, not later than 3 months after the date on which he receives that notice, comply with that request unless it has been withdrawn by that person.

A person who, in a notice served on the Commissioner under subsection (6), supplies any information which is false or misleading in a material particular for the purpose of having the particulars contained in the register relating to that person in that person’s capacity as a data user deleted from the register, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall provide facilities for making the particulars contained in the register available for inspection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by any person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in visible and legible form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: during ordinary office hours; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: free of charge.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on receipt of an application in the specified form from a person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on payment of the prescribed fee,

subsection.continued: provide a copy in writing of the particulars contained in the register in respect of the data user, or the class of data users, specified in the application.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Register shall not limit, etc. operation of this Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not the register contains any particulars;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any particulars contained in the register,

subsection.continued: in respect of a data user shall not of itself—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: limit, restrict or qualify the operation of any of the provisions of this Ordinance (including section 2(5) and the data protection principles) in relation to the data user;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: exempt the data user from the operation of any of the provisions of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) shall not prejudice the operation of any limitation, restriction, qualification or exemption provided for in the other provisions of this Ordinance.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Access to and Correction of Personal Data

section.name: s17A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 5
section.leadIn: Without limiting the definition of relevant person in section 2(1), in this Part—

def.name: RelevantPerson
def.leadIn: relevant person (有關人士), in relation to an individual, also includes a person authorized in writing by the individual to make, on behalf of the individual—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a data access request; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a data correction request.

subsection.leadIn: An individual, or a relevant person on behalf of an individual, may make a request—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be informed by a data user whether the data user holds personal data of which the individual is the data subject;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the data user holds such data, to be supplied by the data user with a copy of such data.

subsection.content: A data access request under both paragraphs of subsection (1) shall be treated as being a single request, and the provisions of this Ordinance shall be construed accordingly.

A data access request under paragraph (a) of subsection (1) may, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be treated as being a data access request under both paragraphs of that subsection, and the provisions of this Ordinance (including subsection (2)) shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: A data user who, in relation to personal data—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not hold the data; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: controls the use of the data in such a way as to prohibit the data user who does hold the data from complying (whether in whole or in part) with a data access request which relates to the data,

subsection.continued: shall be deemed to hold the data, and the provisions of this Ordinance (including this section) shall be construed accordingly. (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, in a data access request, supplies any information which is false or misleading in a material particular for the purposes of having the data user—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the person whether the data user holds any personal data which is the subject of the request; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if applicable, supply a copy of the data. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 11)

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (5) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2) and sections 20 and 28(5), a data user must comply with a data access request within 40 days after receiving the request by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the data user holds any personal data which is the subject of the request—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: informing the requestor in writing that the data user holds the data; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: supplying a copy of the data; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the data user does not hold any personal data which is the subject of the request, informing the requestor in writing that the data user does not hold the data. (Replaced 18 of 2012 s. 12)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1)(b), if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a data access request is made to the Hong Kong Police Force as to whether it holds any record of criminal conviction of an individual; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it does not hold such record,

subsection.continued: it must comply with the request by informing the requestor orally, within 40 days after receiving the request, that it does not hold such record. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: A data user who is unable to comply with a data access request within the period specified in subsection (1) or (1A) shall— (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: before the expiration of that period—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by notice in writing inform the requestor that the data user is so unable and of the reasons why the data user is so unable; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: comply with the request to the extent, if any, that the data user is able to comply with the request; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after the expiration of that period, comply or fully comply, as the case may be, with the request.

subsection.leadIn: A copy of the personal data to be supplied by a data user in compliance with a data access request shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: be supplied by reference to the data at the time when the request is received except that the copy may take account of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: made between that time and the time when the copy is supplied; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that would have been made irrespective of the receipt of the request; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (5), any correction to the data made between that time and the time when the copy is supplied;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where any correction referred to paragraph (a)(ii) has been made to the data, be accompanied by a notice stating that the data has been corrected pursuant to that paragraph (or words to the like effect); and (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 12)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: as far as practicable, be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: intelligible unless the copy is a true copy of a document which—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: contains the data; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is unintelligible on its face;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: readily comprehensible with any codes used by the data user adequately explained; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: subject to sub-subparagraph (B), the language specified in the request or, if no language is so specified, the language in which the request is made (which may be the Chinese or English language in either case);

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.leadIn: a language other than the language specified in the request or, if no language is so specified, the language in which the request is made, if, but only if—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: the language in which the data is held is not the language specified in the request or, if no language is so specified, the language in which the request is made, as the case may be; and (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 12)

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: subject to section 20(2)(b), the copy is a true copy of a document which contains the data;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: without prejudice to the generality of subparagraph (iii) but subject to subsection (4), be in the form, or one of the forms, if any, specified in the request;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: where subparagraph (iv) is not applicable, in such form as the data user thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a data access request specifies the form or forms in which a copy of the personal data to be supplied in compliance with the request is or are sought; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the data user concerned is unable to supply the copy in that form or any of those forms, as the case may be, because it is not practicable for the data user to do so,

subsection.continued: then the data user shall—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: where there is only one form in which it is practicable for the data user to supply the copy, supply the copy in that form accompanied by a notice in writing informing the requestor that that form is the only form in which it is practicable for the data user to supply the copy;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: in any other case—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.leadIn: as soon as practicable, by notice in writing inform the requestor—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: that it is not practicable for the data user to supply the copy in the form or any of the forms, as the case may be, specified in the request;

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: of the forms in which it is practicable for the data user to supply the copy; and

subparagraph.name: III
subparagraph.content: that the requestor may, not later than 14 days after the requestor has received the notice, specify in writing one of the forms referred to in sub-subparagraph (II) in which the copy is to be supplied; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.leadIn: as soon as practicable, supply the copy—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: in the form specified in the response, if any, to the notice referred to in subparagraph (A);

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: if there is no such response within the period specified in subparagraph (A)(III), supply the copy in any one of the forms referred to in subparagraph (A)(II) as the data user thinks fit.

subsection.content: Subparagraph (ii) of paragraph (a) and paragraph (b) of subsection (3) shall expire on the 1st anniversary of the appointed day.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Circumstances in which data user shall or may refuse to comply with data access request

subsection.leadIn: A data user shall refuse to comply with a data access request—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the data user is not supplied with such information as the data user may reasonably require—

subparagraph.content: in order to satisfy the data user as to the identity of the requestor;

subparagraph.leadIn: where the requestor purports to be a relevant person, in order to satisfy the data user—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: as to the identity of the individual in relation to whom the requestor purports to be such a person; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that the requestor is such a person in relation to that individual;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), if the data user cannot comply with the request without disclosing personal data of which any other individual is the data subject unless the data user is satisfied that the other individual has consented to the disclosure of the data to the requestor; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other case, if compliance with the request is for the time being prohibited under this or any other Ordinance. (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 13)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(b) shall not operate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: so that the reference in that subsection to personal data of which any other individual is the data subject includes a reference to information identifying that individual as the source of the personal data to which the data access request concerned relates unless that information names or otherwise explicitly identifies that individual;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so as to excuse a data user from complying with the data access request concerned to the extent that the request may be complied with without disclosing the identity of the other individual, whether by the omission of names, or other identifying particulars, or otherwise.

subsection.leadIn: A data user may refuse to comply with a data access request if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the request is not in writing in the Chinese or English language;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the data user is not supplied with such information as the data user may reasonably require to locate the personal data to which the request relates;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the request follows 2 or more similar requests made by—

subparagraph.content: the individual who is the data subject in respect of the personal data to which the request relates;
one or more relevant persons on behalf of that individual; or
any combination of that individual and those relevant persons,

paragraph.continued: and it is unreasonable in all the circumstances for the data user to comply with the request;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (4), any other data user controls the use of the data in such a way as to prohibit the first-mentioned data user from complying (whether in whole or in part) with the request;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the form in which the request shall be made has been specified under section 67 and the request is not made in that form; (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 13)

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: the data user is entitled under this or any other Ordinance not to comply with the request; or (Added 18 of 2012 s. 13)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in any other case, compliance with the request may for the time being be refused under this Ordinance, whether by virtue of an exemption under Part 8 or otherwise.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3)(d) shall not operate so as to excuse a data user from complying with the data access request concerned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in so far as the request relates to section 18(1)(a), to any extent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in so far as the request relates to section 18(1)(b), to any extent that the data user can comply with the request without contravening the prohibition concerned.

subsection.leadIn: Despite any provision in any relevant Ordinance or its subsidiary legislation in relation to discovery and inspection, in any proceedings under this Ordinance, a specified body—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may, for the purpose of deciding on the issue as to whether a data user is required or entitled to refuse to comply with a data access request under this section or deciding on any question related to that issue, require the personal data which is the subject of the request to be made available for its inspection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not require the personal data to be disclosed to any party to the proceedings, whether by discovery or otherwise, unless it has decided that the data user must comply with the request. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 13)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (5)—
subsection.def: proceedings under this Ordinance (根據本條例進行的法律程序) has the same meaning given by section 13(4);

def.name: RelevantOrdinance
def.leadIn: relevant Ordinance (有關條例) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Administrative Appeals Board Ordinance (Cap. 442);

subsection.def: specified body (指明當局) has the same meaning given by section 13(4). (Added 18 of 2012 s. 13)

section.name: s21
section.heading: Notification of refusal to comply with data access request

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a data user who pursuant to section 20 refuses to comply with a data access request shall, as soon as practicable but, in any case, not later than 40 days after receiving the request, by notice in writing inform the requestor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of the refusal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), of the reasons for the refusal; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where section 20(3)(d) is applicable, of the name and address of the other data user concerned.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a data user has pursuant to section 20 refused to comply with a data access request; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the refusal also relates to section 18(1)(a) by virtue of section 63,

subsection.continued: then the data user may, in the notice under subsection (1) concerned, in place of the matters of which the data user is required to inform the requestor under that subsection, inform the requestor that the data user has no personal data the existence of which he is required to disclose to the requestor (or words to the like effect).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (1A) and (2), where— (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of personal data has been supplied by a data user in compliance with a data access request; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the individual, or a relevant person on behalf of the individual, who is the data subject considers that the data is inaccurate, (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 15)

subsection.continued: then that individual or relevant person, as the case may be, may make a request that the data user make the necessary correction to the data.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: If a person is a relevant person in relation to an individual only because the person has been authorized in writing by the individual to make a data access request on behalf of the individual, the person is not entitled to make a data correction request. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 15)

subsection.leadIn: A data user who, in relation to personal data—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not hold the data; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: controls the processing of the data in such a way as to prohibit the data user who does hold the data from complying (whether in whole or in part) with section 23(1) in relation to a data correction request which relates to the data,

subsection.continued: shall be deemed to be a data user to whom such a request may be made, and the provisions of this Ordinance (including subsection (1)) shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of sections 23(1)(c) and 25(2), if a data user, subsequent to the receipt of a data correction request but before complying with the request pursuant to section 23 or refusing to comply with the request pursuant to section 25, discloses to a third party the personal data to which the request relates, then the user shall take all practicable steps to advise the third party that the data is the subject of a data correction request still under consideration by the user (or words to the like effect). (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 15; 17 of 2018 s. 128)

A person who, in a data correction request, supplies any information which is false or misleading in a material particular for the purpose of having the personal data corrected as indicated in the request, commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 15)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2) and section 24, a data user who is satisfied that personal data to which a data correction request relates is inaccurate shall, not later than 40 days after receiving the request— (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make the necessary correction to the data;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: supply the requestor with a copy of the data as so corrected; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (3), if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the data has been disclosed to a third party during the 12 months immediately preceding the day on which the correction is made; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the data user has no reason to believe that the third party has ceased using the data for the purpose (including any directly related purpose) for which the data was disclosed to the third party,

paragraph.continued: take all practicable steps to supply the third party with a copy of the data as so corrected accompanied by a notice in writing stating the reasons for the correction.

subsection.leadIn: A data user who is unable to comply with subsection (1) in relation to a data correction request within the period specified in that subsection shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: before the expiration of that period—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by notice in writing inform the requestor that the data user is so unable and of the reasons why the data user is so unable; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: comply with that subsection to the extent, if any, that the data user is able to comply with that subsection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after the expiration of that period, comply or fully comply, as the case may be, with that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: A data user is not required to comply with subsection (1)(c) in any case where the disclosure concerned of the personal data to the third party consists of the third party’s inspection of a register or other like document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in which the data is entered or otherwise recorded; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which is available for inspection by the public,

subsection.continued: but this subsection shall not apply if the third party has been supplied with a copy, certified by or under the authority of the data user to be correct, of the data.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Circumstances in which data user shall or may refuse to comply with data correction request

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a data user shall refuse to comply with section 23(1) in relation to a data correction request if the data user is not supplied with such information as the data user may reasonably require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in order to satisfy the data user as to the identity of the requestor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the requestor purports to be a relevant person, in order to satisfy the data user—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as to the identity of the individual in relation to whom the requestor purports to be such a person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that the requestor is such a person in relation to that individual.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) shall not apply to a data correction request where the requestor is the same person as the requestor in respect of the data access request which gave rise to the data correction request.

subsection.leadIn: A data user may refuse to comply with section 23(1) in relation to a data correction request if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the request is not in writing in the Chinese or English language;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the data user is not satisfied that the personal data to which the request relates is inaccurate; (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 2)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the data user is not supplied with such information as the data user may reasonably require to ascertain in what way the personal data to which the request relates is inaccurate; (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 2)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the data user is not satisfied that the correction which is the subject of the request is accurate; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (4), any other data user controls the processing of the personal data to which the request relates in such a way as to prohibit the first-mentioned data user from complying (whether in whole or in part) with that section.

subsection.content: Subsection (3)(e) shall not operate so as to excuse a data user from complying with section 23(1) in relation to the data correction request concerned to the extent that the data user can comply with that section without contravening the prohibition concerned.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Notification of refusal to comply with data correction request, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A data user who pursuant to section 24 refuses to comply with section 23(1) in relation to a data correction request shall, as soon as practicable but, in any case, not later than 40 days after receiving the request, by notice in writing inform the requestor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of the refusal and the reasons for the refusal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where section 24(3)(e) is applicable, of the name and address of the other data user concerned.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the personal data to which a data correction request relates is an expression of opinion; and (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the data user concerned is not satisfied that the opinion is inaccurate,

subsection.continued: then the data user shall—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: make a note, whether annexed to that data or elsewhere—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: of the matters in respect of which the opinion is considered by the requestor to be inaccurate; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in such a way that that data cannot be used by a person (including the data user and a third party) without the note being drawn to the attention of, and being available for inspection by, that person; and (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 2)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: attach a copy of the note to the notice referred to in subsection (1) which relates to that request.

def.name: ExpressionOfOpinion
def.leadIn: In this section, expression of opinion (意見表達) includes an assertion of fact which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is unverifiable; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in all the circumstances of the case, is not practicable to verify.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Erasure of personal data no longer required

subsection.leadIn: A data user must take all practicable steps to erase personal data held by the data user where the data is no longer required for the purpose (including any directly related purpose) for which the data was used unless— (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 17)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any such erasure is prohibited under any law; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is in the public interest (including historical interest) for the data not to be erased.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a data user must take all practicable steps to erase personal data in accordance with subsection (1) notwithstanding that any other data user controls (whether in whole or in part) the processing of the data; (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 17)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the first-mentioned data user shall not be liable in an action for damages at the suit of the second-mentioned data user in respect of any such erasure.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Log book to be kept by data user

subsection.leadIn: A data user shall keep and maintain a log book—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of this Part;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the Chinese or English language; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: such that any particulars entered in the log book pursuant to this section are not erased therefrom before the expiration of—

subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), 4 years after the day on which they were so entered;
such longer or shorter period as may be prescribed, either generally or in any particular case, by regulations made under section 70.

subsection.leadIn: A data user shall in accordance with subsection (3) enter in the log book—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: where pursuant to section 21(2) the data user does not comply with section 21(1), particulars of the prejudice that would be caused to the interest protected by the exemption concerned under Part 8 if the existence or non-existence of the personal data to which the data access request concerned relates was disclosed; (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 2)

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: any other particulars required by regulations made under section 70 to be entered in the log book.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars required by subsection (2) to be entered by a data user in the log book shall be so entered—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
d
paragraph.content: in the case of particulars referred to in paragraph (d) of that subsection, within the period specified in regulations made under section 70 in respect of those particulars.

subsection.leadIn: A data user shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: permit the Commissioner to inspect and copy the log book (or any part thereof) at any reasonable time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without charge, afford the Commissioner such facilities and assistance as the Commissioner may reasonably require for the purposes of such inspection and copying.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Imposition of fees by data user

subsection.content: A data user shall not impose a fee for complying or refusing to comply with a data access request or data correction request unless the imposition of the fee is expressly permitted by this section.
Subject to subsections (3) and (4), a data user may impose a fee for complying with a data access request.
No fee imposed for complying with a data access request shall be excessive.

Where pursuant to section 19(3)(c)(iv) or (v) or (4)(ii)(B)(II) a data user may comply with a data access request by supplying a copy of the personal data to which the request relates in one of 2 or more forms, the data user shall not, and irrespective of the form in which the data user complies with the request, impose a fee for complying with the request which is higher than the lowest fee the data user imposes for complying with the request in any of those forms.
A data user may refuse to comply with a data access request unless and until any fee imposed by the data user for complying with the request has been paid.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a data user has complied with a data access request by supplying a copy of the personal data to which the request relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the data subject, or a relevant person on behalf of the data subject, requests the data user to supply a further copy of that data, (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 2)

subsection.continued: then the data user may, and notwithstanding the fee, if any, that the data user imposed for complying with that data access request, impose a fee for supplying that further copy which is not more than the administrative and other costs incurred by the data user in supplying that further copy.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Service and language of certain notices
section.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of section 68, where pursuant to a data access request or data correction request a data user is required to, or may, inform a requestor of any matter by notice in writing, then the requestor shall be deemed not to be so informed unless and until the requestor is served with the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the language in which the request is made if that language is Chinese or English;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, in the Chinese or English language as the data user thinks fit.

part.name: P6
part.heading: Matching Procedures and Transfers of Personal Data, etc.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Matching procedure not to be carried out except with consent of data subject, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A data user shall not carry out, whether in whole or in part, a matching procedure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless and until each individual who is a data subject of the personal data the subject of that procedure has given his prescribed consent to the procedure being carried out;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless and until the Commissioner has consented under section 32 to the procedure being carried out;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: unless the procedure—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: belongs to a class of matching procedures specified in a notice under subsection (2); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is carried out in accordance with the conditions, if any, specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: unless it is required or permitted under any provision of any Ordinance specified in Schedule 4.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, the Commissioner may, by notice in the Gazette, specify—

paragraph.name: a
