subsection.content: All practicable steps must be taken to ensure that personal data is not kept longer than is necessary for the fulfillment of the purpose (including any directly related purpose) for which the data is or is to be used. (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 40)

Without limiting subsection (2), if a data user engages a data processor, whether within or outside Hong Kong, to process personal data on the data user’s behalf, the data user must adopt contractual or other means to prevent any personal data transferred to the data processor from being kept longer than is necessary for processing of the data. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 40)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3)—

def.name: DataProcessor
def.leadIn: data processor (資料處理者) means a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: processes personal data on behalf of another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not process the data for any of the person’s own purposes. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 40)

subsection.content: Personal data shall not, without the prescribed consent of the data subject, be used for a new purpose. (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 40)

subsection.leadIn: A relevant person in relation to a data subject may, on his or her behalf, give the prescribed consent required for using his or her personal data for a new purpose if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the data subject is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a minor;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: incapable of managing his or her own affairs; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: mentally incapacitated within the meaning of section 2 of the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the data subject is incapable of understanding the new purpose and deciding whether to give the prescribed consent; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the relevant person has reasonable grounds for believing that the use of the data for the new purpose is clearly in the interest of the data subject. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 40)

subsection.content: A data user must not use the personal data of a data subject for a new purpose even if the prescribed consent for so using that data has been given under subsection (2) by a relevant person, unless the data user has reasonable grounds for believing that the use of that data for the new purpose is clearly in the interest of the data subject. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 40)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: NewPurpose
def.leadIn: new purpose (新目的), in relation to the use of personal data, means any purpose other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purpose for which the data was to be used at the time of the collection of the data; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a purpose directly related to the purpose referred to in paragraph (a). (Added 18 of 2012 s. 40)

subsection.leadIn: All practicable steps shall be taken to ensure that any personal data (including data in a form in which access to or processing of the data is not practicable) held by a data user is protected against unauthorized or accidental access, processing, erasure, loss or use having particular regard to— (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 40; 17 of 2018 s. 129)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the kind of data and the harm that could result if any of those things should occur;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the physical location where the data is stored; (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 40)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any security measures incorporated (whether by automated means or otherwise) into any equipment in which the data is stored; (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 40)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any measures taken for ensuring the integrity, prudence and competence of persons having access to the data; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any measures taken for ensuring the secure transmission of the data.

subsection.content: Without limiting subsection (1), if a data user engages a data processor, whether within or outside Hong Kong, to process personal data on the data user’s behalf, the data user must adopt contractual or other means to prevent unauthorized or accidental access, processing, erasure, loss or use of the data transferred to the data processor for processing. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 40)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—
subsection.def: data processor (資料處理者) has the same meaning given by subsection (4) of data protection principle 2. (Added 18 of 2012 s. 40)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Principle 5—information to be generally available
section.leadIn: All practicable steps shall be taken to ensure that a person can—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ascertain a data user’s policies and practices in relation to personal data;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be informed of the kind of personal data held by a data user;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be informed of the main purposes for which personal data held by a data user is or is to be used. (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 40)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Principle 6—access to personal data
section.leadIn: A data subject shall be entitled to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ascertain whether a data user holds personal data of which he is the data subject;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: request access to personal data—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: within a reasonable time;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at a fee, if any, that is not excessive;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in a reasonable manner; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in a form that is intelligible;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be given reasons if a request referred to in paragraph (b) is refused;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: object to a refusal referred to in paragraph (c);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: request the correction of personal data;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: be given reasons if a request referred to in paragraph (e) is refused; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: object to a refusal referred to in paragraph (f).

subsection.leadIn: The resources of the Commissioner shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: all money—

subparagraph.content: paid by the Government to the Commissioner and appropriated for that purpose by the Legislative Council; and
otherwise provided to the Commissioner by the Government; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all other money and property, including gifts, donations, fees, rent, interest and accumulations of income received by the Commissioner.

subsection.content: The Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury may give directions in writing of a general or specific character to the Commissioner in relation to the amount of money which may be expended by the Commissioner in any financial year and the Commissioner shall comply with those directions. (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002)

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that any remuneration or other benefit payable to, and any expenses of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person employed or engaged under section 9(1) of this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: shall be paid out of the resources of the Commissioner.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Commissioner may borrow by way of overdraft such money as he may require for meeting his obligations or performing his functions under this Ordinance.

The Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs may, after consulting with the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury, give directions in writing of a general or specific character to the Commissioner in relation to the amount of money which may be borrowed under subsection (1) and the Commissioner shall comply with those directions.

The Commissioner may with the approval of the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs given after the Secretary has consulted with the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury borrow, otherwise than by way of overdraft, such money as he may require for meeting his obligations or performing his functions under this Ordinance.

A person lending money to the Commissioner shall not be concerned to inquire whether the borrowing of the money is legal or regular or whether the money raised has been properly applied and shall not be prejudiced by any illegality or irregularity or by misapplication or non-application of the money.
Subject to subsection (2), the Commissioner may invest money that is not immediately required to be expended.

The Commissioner shall not invest money pursuant to subsection (1) except in such forms of investment as the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs, after consulting with the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury, approves. (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007)
Subsection (1) shall not be subject to section 10(1) of this Ordinance.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Accounts, audit and annual report of Commissioner

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall cause proper accounts to be kept of all his financial transactions.

The Commissioner shall, as soon as practicable after the expiry of a financial year, prepare a statement of the accounts of the Commissioner, which statement shall include an income and expenditure account and a balance sheet.

The Commissioner shall appoint an auditor who shall, as soon as practicable, audit the accounts required under subsection (1) and the statement of accounts required under subsection (2) and shall submit a report on the statement to the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall, as soon as practicable and in any case not later than 9 months after the expiry of a financial year (or such further period as the Chief Secretary for Administration allows), furnish—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a copy of the statement of accounts required under subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the auditor’s report on the statement,

subsection.continued: to the Chief Secretary for Administration who shall cause the same to be tabled in the Legislative Council. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

subsection.content: This section shall not be subject to section 10(1) of this Ordinance.

The Director of Audit may, in respect of any financial year, conduct an examination into the economy, efficiency and effectiveness with which the Commissioner has expended his resources in performing his functions and exercising his powers.

Subject to subsection (3), the Director of Audit shall have a right of access at all reasonable times to all such documents as he may reasonably require for conducting an examination under this section and shall be entitled to require from any person holding or being accountable for any such document such information and explanation as he considers reasonably necessary for that purpose.
Subsection (2) applies only to documents in the custody and control of the Commissioner.
The Director of Audit may report to the President of the Legislative Council the results of an examination conducted by him under this section.
Subsection (1) shall not operate to entitle the Director of Audit to question the merits of the policy objectives of the Commissioner.
The Commissioner shall be exempt from taxation under the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112).

For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that subsection (1) does not apply to or in relation to any remuneration, benefits or expenses referred to in section 1(3) paid out of the resources of the Commissioner to the Commissioner.

schedule.name: sch4
schedule.heading: Provisions of Ordinance under which Matching Procedures are Required or Permitted

section.name: s1
section.content: Whether the carrying out of the matching procedure is in the public interest.

section.name: s2
section.content: The kind of personal data to be the subject of the matching procedure.

section.name: s3
section.content: The likely consequences to a data subject if the matching procedure were to result in any adverse action taken against the data subject.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: The practices and procedures, if any, that will be followed to enable a data subject to make a data correction request—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of the personal data produced or verified by the matching procedure; (Amended 18 of 2012 s. 42)

paragraph.name: b

part.heading: Warrant Authorizing Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data to Enter Specified Premises without Informing Relevant Data User

td.p: To the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data.

Having been satisfied by information on oath/by affirmation* that there are reasonable grounds for believing that the purposes of an investigation under the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486) in relation to . [name of relevant data user] may be substantially prejudiced if you were required to comply with section 42(3) of that Ordinance before exercising your power under section 42(2) of that Ordinance in respect of the premises at . .
